official_title: A bill to amend the National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act of 1966 and the Motor Vehicle Information and Cost Savings Act to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 1979and 1980.
short_title: National Traffic Safety and Motor Vehicle Information Authorization and Amendments Act

summary.text: (Reported to Senate from the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation with amendment, S. Rept. 95-861) National Traffic Safety and Motor Vehicle Information Authorization and Amendments Act - =Title I: Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety= - Amends the National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act of 1966 to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 1979, 1980, and 1981, to carry out the provisions of such Act. Exempts tire retreaders from certain reporting requirements of such Act. =Title II: Motor Vehicle Information and Cost Savings= - Amends the Motor Vehicle Information and Cost Savings Act to authorize appropriations for fiscal years 1979, 1980, and 1981, to carry out the provisions of such Act. Permits the Secretary of Transportation, based upon certain findings, to temporarily exempt or renew the exemption of motor vehicles from the bumper standards required by such Act. Directs the Secretary to require permanent labeling of each exempted vehicle. States that no such exemption or renewal shall be granted for more than three years, and no renewal shall be granted without reapplication and approval. Limits a manufacturer's eligibility in applying for an exemption under specified criteria to 2,500 vehicles to be sold in the United States in any 12-month period, as determined by the Secretary. Requires that any manufacturer applying for an exemption to submit a detailed analysis to support the claim for the need for such exemption. Provides that the annual report requirements in regard to bumper standards be incorporated with the annual report under such Act. Authorizes the Secretary to exempt certain classes of motor vehicles from the odometer requirements.
